title: Dimitar Berbatov explains why Man Utd need to sign Mario Mandzukic
text:

Dimitar Berbatov believes Mario Mandzukic would good signing for Manchester United as the club look to solve their problems up front.

The Red Devils have endured a difficult start to the Premier League season and entered the international break in 12th after picking up just one point from their last three matches.

Ole Gunnar Solskjaer's side have particularly struggled going forward and have failed to score more than one goal in a single game since their 4-0 win over Chelsea on the opening weekend of the season.

United were criticised for their decision not to sign replacements for Alexis Sanchez and Romelu Lukaku after their summer departures to Inter Milan and Solskjaer's forward options have been further affected by injuries to Anthony Martial, Marcus Rashford and Mason Greenwood.

(Image: AFP)

With the club reportedly considering a January move for former Juventus striker Mandzukic, Berbatov believes the 33-year-old is exactly the kind of player needed at Old Trafford.

"When you sell two of your main strikers you need to bring in at least one, just in case," the former United striker told Betfair .

"Everybody can see that that Manchester United need a back up, Anthony Martial is injured and there isn't another really strong proven goalscorer.

"They have the talent in the young players but at the same time you need someone like Mario Mandzukic.

(Image: Man Utd via Getty)

"I think he is a really good football player and he hasn't played before in England but I hope if he comes he can straight away get into the rhythm of the Premier League.

Since completing a move from Atletico Madrid in 2015, Mandzukic has scored 44 goals in 162 appearances for Juventus and helped the club to claim the Serie A title in each of his four seasons in Italy.

Although the Croatian is yet to feature this season after falling down the pecking order in Maurizio Sarri's side, Berbatov believes the striker could use his vast experience to help United and compared him to Zlatan Ibrahimovic, who impressed for the club during the 2016/17 season.

(Image: Getty Images)

The Bulgarian, who won two Premier League titles during his time at Old Trafford, added: "Zlatan Ibrahimovic was 34 when he signed for United and he didn't have any problems.

"Mandzukic is a similar age and hope he could have the same impact if he signs.

"I think his age is a good thing; Martial, Rashford and Greenwood are all young players so they need that time and assurance that they don't need to worry and they can learn from the experience of Mandzukic."
description: The former Red Devils striker believes manager OIe Gunnar Solskjaer needs to strengthen his attacking options
